article.title: Consequences of minimal seesaw with complex $μτ$ antisymmetry of neutrinos

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the sky blue (deep blue) color in the plots represent?
choices: Parameter space for both mass orderings
Parameter space for normal mass ordering
Parameter space for inverted mass ordering
Ranges for the washout parameters

multiple_choice_question.text: What is being plotted against the sum of light neutrino masses (Σi mi) in Figure 2?
choices: The lightest neutrino mass
The effective Majorana mass |Mee|
The baryon asymmetry parameter YB
The mass of the lightest right-handed neutrino M1

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the first figure in the left panel of Figure 3 depict?
choices: The variation of YB with rescaled parameters
The ranges for the washout parameters
A comparison of YB for different mass ratios of RH neutrinos
The correlation between |Mee| and the sum of light neutrino masses

multiple_choice_question.text: What relationship is being illustrated in Figure 4 for a specific set of rescaled parameters?
choices: The variation of |Mee| with the lightest right-handed neutrino mass M1
The correlation between the baryon asymmetry parameter YB and M1
The dependence of the washout parameters on M1
The impact of different RH neutrino mass hierarchies on YB

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Formula (6.14) represent a simplified expression for?
choices: The effective Majorana mass |Mee|
The loop function g(xij) for a hierarchical RH neutrino scheme
The baryon asymmetry parameter YB in the τ-flavored regime
The washout mass parameter m˜2
